pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 6 Pansear
Timer: Adds 6 Rocks after 3 moves
          Adds 6 Pansear after 3 moves
          Repeat
clearingStrategy:
[Blastoise]/[Swampert]/
[Garchomp]

Excadrill, Milotic,
Stunfisk, Seismitoad,
Tyranitar

Terrakion, Greninja,
Gliscor, Suicune

Palkia, Groudon,
Kyogre, Gigalith
srankingStrategy:
Consider bringing Tyranitar to eject
some of the Pansear and match the
leftover ones. Other than that, the stage
is not hard to beat.

Lugia can be better to clear the
Pansear, even though it is not
Super Effective
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Catching Pansear and bringing it is the
best option to S rank this stage itemless. It 
is not that easy though, you need to combo
quite a lot. M-Gengar can work too.

Moves +5 is helpful in case you can't catch
Pansear and want to move on with S ranks.

pokemon:
Board: 7 Metal blocks
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Metal blocks every 3 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Gengar]/[Blaziken]/
[Charizard Y]

Salamence, Braviary,
Ninetales

Heatran, Moltres,
Delphox

Reshiram, Ho-Oh,
Lugia, Talonflame,
Gigalith
srankingStrategy:
Bringing Block Smash+ Pokémon
really helps here. Gengar is the best
Mega, as this is a 3 Pokémon stage.

Activate Block Smash+, and the
combos will follow.

If you happen to have none of the
Block Smash+ Pokémon, the stage
will be less easy but not undoable
itemless. Simple Block Smash will
still help.
notes:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Doable itemless with Block Smash+.
Without that, consider bringing a Moves +5
to give time to the Metal blocks to
disappear.

pokemon:
Board: 4 Metal blocks and Phantump
          Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 4 Phantump on after 3
          moves (in place of the Metal blocks)
          Adds 8 Phantump on rows and 2
          after 3 moves
          Repeat
clearingStrategy:
[Gengar]/[Banette]/
[Absol]/[Sharpedo]

Zoroark, Weavile,
Mandibuzz, Phantump

Yveltal, Malamar,
Bisharp

Giratina, Darkrai,
Dusknoir
srankingStrategy:
Doable itemless. The disruption will
clear a lot of the Barriers, and anyways
Phantump is Super Effective, so do
not be afraid to match some of them
to clear the board a bit.
notes:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Same as Pansear, bringing Phantump can
yield an itemless S rank.

Nothing more than Moves +5 is needed,
even without bringing Phantump.

pokemon:
Board: 6 Metal blocks
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Barriers in columns 3 and 4
          after 4 moves (in initial place of the
          Metal Blocks)
          Adds 6 Metal Blocks in columns 3 and
          4 after 4 moves (in the initial place of
          the Metal blocks)
          Repeat
clearingStrategy:
[Gengar]/[Sharpedo]/
[Absol]/[Heracross]/
[Banette]

Scyther, Scizor,
Volcarona, Zoroark

Genesect, Yveltal,
Bisharp, Malamar

Giratina, Pinsir,
Darkrai, Dialga
srankingStrategy:
Dialga is very useful to get rid of 
Metal blocks to clear the board 
a bit. Other Block Smash+ work too,
but Dialga is the most powerful of
them.

If you don't have Dialga, just try to
make the metal blocks fall on the
bottom, to make combos in the top
rows.

Doable itemless.
notes:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Doable itemless with a Block Smash+
Pokémon. The disruptions won't be an
issue as you will have depleted most
of the HP bar already.

pokemon:
Board: 4 Metal blocks in the center, black
          clouds
Initial: None
Timer: Adds either 3 Metal blocks or 3
          black clouds every 3 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Mewtwo Y]/[Slowbro]/
[Garchomp]

Excadrill, Stunfisk,
Deoxys, Marowak

Glisccor

Cresselia, Victini,
Groudon
srankingStrategy:
Bringing Dialga (or a Block Smash+)
helps quite a bit to remove early the
metal blocks in the middle.
After that, it also helps for removing
the disruptions when they are metal.

Other than that it's a pretty straight-
forward stage, Mewtwo or Garchomp
both work fine as Mega here.
No items needed.
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

A Moves +5 is needed here to secure the
S rank. Just get rid of rocks early, and pile
up the damage.

pokemon:
Board: 6 Parasect, Barriers in columns 1,2,
          5 and 6
Initial: None
Timer: None
clearingStrategy:
[Gengar]/[Blaziken]/
[Charizard Y]

Salamence, Braviary,
Ninetales

Heatran, Moltres,
Delphox

Reshiram, Ho-Oh,
Lugia
srankingStrategy:
First move: C5 <-> D5. Will remove
all barriers. Easy to finish the stage
after that.

No items needed.
notes:
Moves: At least 0 moves left

Clearing strategy will do it.

pokemon:
Board: 8 Metal blocks and 6 Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Metal blocks every 3 moves
            
           HP<=52%:
           Fills row 1 with Metal blocks every 2
           moves
clearingStrategy:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Heracross]/[Gardevoir]

Conkeldurr, Scyther,
Scizor, Pangoro

Xerneas, Gallade,
Genesect

Diancie, Machamp,
Pinsir
srankingStrategy:
So the set up is really bad. Bringing a
Block Smash+ AND a Barrier Bash+
is very helpful (Gallade and Diancie).
Activate one or the other to slowly
clear the board and then damage a lot
with Genesect and M-Heracross.
No items are needed with this.

If you don't have Gallade or/and
Diancie, this gets a lot harder.
You may need a Moves +5 to clear.
notes:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Moves +5 may not be enough, so throw in
a Disruption Delay too to have a clear board
faster and get this right. I see no good
Pokémon to use Mega Start with on this
stage unfortunately. Maybe Gardevoir.

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: Fills a random column with Rocks
Timer: Fills a random column with Rocks
          every 3 moves

           HP<=40%:
          Fills a random column with Rocks
          and adds 6 Rocks and 2 Metal blocks
          every 3 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Gengar]/[Banette]/
[Absol]/[Sharpedo]

Zoroark, Weavile,
Mandibuzz

Yveltal, Malamar,
Bisharp

Giratina, Darkrai,
Dusknoir
srankingStrategy:
The disruptions are really annoying on
this stage. If you don't have Giratina or
Darkrai, it will be hard to deal a lot of
damage or to prevent disruptions.
Absol's Mind zap can do wonders here
if it activates.

A Moves +5 should do it instead of a
Disruption Delay to clear,just make
sure to always match near the Rocks,
and try to activate Absol when the
Disruption counter hits 1.

Keeping Gengar as Mega is the best
call here.
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Disruption Delay (and Moves +5) should 
secure this, without these 2 it is very 
inconsistent to get good results, especially
when Absol and Darkrai troll you and never
do anything.

If you buy a DD, then do not bring Absol,
get a stronger Pokémon instead, like
Yveltal.

Gengar is the best mega here.

pokemon:
Board: 4 Barriers in the Center, 3 Barrier
          Rocks in every corner
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Barrier Rocks and 2 Metal
          blocks every 2 moves (in row 1 and 2)
clearingStrategy:
[Gengar]/[Sharpedo]/
[Absol]/[Heracross]/
[Banette]

Scyther, Scizor,
Volcarona, Zoroark

Genesect, Yveltal,
Bisharp, Malamar

Giratina, Pinsir,
Darkrai
srankingStrategy:
Stage doable itemless. M-Gengar
because it's a 3 Pokémon stage,
Bisharp to remove rocks, and
Genesect for damage.

Even without Bisharp, the stage is 
doable itemless, just be careful to
match near top rocks first.
notes:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Doable itemless. Moves +5 is you find
yourself always short on moves. Should
S rank with luck after some tries.

disruptions:
soon, forgot to take it so
will do it when i have 
hearts to spend


sorry
pokemon:
Board: Metal block in each corner, 20 black
          clouds in the center
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 8 Metal blocks after 2 moves
          Adds 8 black clouds after 2 moves
          Repeat
clearingStrategy:
[Mewtwo Y]/[Slowbro]/
[Garchomp]

Excadrill, Stunfisk,
Deoxys, Marowak,
Golurk

Gliscor

Cresselia, Victini,
Groudon, Dialga
srankingStrategy:
This level is doable itemless, however
you will be reliant on combos, and
activationd Block Smash+ with
Dialga. The clouds are not really
a problem, just takes time to scout
the board.

If you cannot deal more than 2/3
of the HP bar itemless, throw in a 
Disruption Delay using M Garchomp
or M Mewtwo Y and you will get through
this level.
notes:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Disruption Delay and Moves +5 are a must
have for this S rank. Mega Mewtwo Y works
well to get it. Add Dialga or Golurk if you
have it for the Block Smash+ ability.

pokemon:
Board: None 
Initial: Adds 2 Spearow and 2 Metal blocks
         in row 1
Timer: Adds 2 Spearow and 2 Metal blocks
         in row 5 after 1 move
           Adds 2 Spearow and 2 Metal blocks
         in row 1 after 2 moves
         Repeat
clearingStrategy:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]

Avalugg, Dedenne,
Tyranitar

Zapdos, Articuno,
Mamoswine, Luxray

Thundurus, Kyurem,
Zekrom
srankingStrategy:
Stage is easy to beat itemless, try
to make the disruptions fall to the
bottom so you can ccombo relatively
easily on the rest of the board.

Zekrom and Gigalith are super nice
since they have Block Smash+ and
it always activates in a 4 match.

Can bring Tyranitar too to remove
the disrupted Spearow, but they are
not that much of a problem.
notes:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

A bit reliant on luck to do itemless, but
it depends whether you want to invest a
Moves +5 to guarantee this S rank.

pokemon:
Board: 2 Barriers and 10 Rocks (H shape)
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 4 Rocks and 1 Barrier after 3
          moves (left part of the H), then
          adds 4 Rocks and 1 Barrier (right
          part of the H) immediately after
clearingStrategy:
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]/
[Venusaur]

Roserade, Gogoat,
Dedenne

Zapdos, Raikou, Virizion,
Luxray, Chesnaught

Zekrom, Thundurus,
Shaymin
srankingStrategy:
Stage is not that hard to beat,
remove the rocks as fast as possible
to deal damage. Getting the barriers
is a plus, but by that time the disruption
should happen again, so do not
worry too much about removing the
barriers, you can beat the level
fine without focusing on them.
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Did it itemless with M-Gengar, Shaymin,
Zekrom and Roserade. Have Shaymin
activate Sleep Charm and this will
be an easy S rank itemless.

Moves +5 if you do not have
the patience.

pokemon:
Board: Rocks, Barriers and 2 Metal blocks
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 4 Rocks and 2 Metal blocks
          and Barrier them, every 3 moves

Note: The disruption pattern is the same as 
the initial board on row 3 and 4.
          
         Added support: Rocks
clearingStrategy:
[Blastoise]/[Swampert]/
[Garchomp]

Excadrill, Milotic,
Stunfisk, Seismitoad,
Tyranitar

Terrakion, Greninja,
Gliscor, Suicune

Palkia, Groudon,
Kyogre, Gigalith
srankingStrategy:
Easy stage, no need for items.
Have Palkia try to remove barriers to
deal more damage in between the 
disruptions, and that's it. The HP
is not very high, you should not have
trouble beating this stage.

Kyogre can help too with Rock Break,
it's not that bad.
notes:
Moves: At least 12 moves left

This can be done itemless if you get some
good combos, but should you struggle, a
Moves +5 is enough, no Disruption Delay
is needed here.

pokemon:
Board: 4 Barrier Rocks, and 12 Spheal
Initial: None
Timer: None
clearingStrategy:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Blaziken]/[Charizad Y]/
[Mawile]

Steelix, Klinklang,
Conkeldurr, Pangoro,
Tyranitar

Gallade, Delphox,
Moltres, Terrakion
srankingStrategy:
First move B3-E3 (or E4-B4) will 
remove  all the Spheal. Be careful 
not to activate Eject with Tyranitar, 
else you will not remove everything.

After that the stage will become super
easy.
notes:
Moves: At least 0 moves left

Clearing strategy will do this.

pokemon:
Board: Rocks in Y shape
Initial: None
Timer: Adds Rocks in the Y shape every
          2 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Charizard Y]/[Blaziken]/
[Heracross]/[Gengar]

Avalugg, Salamence,
Braviary, Scyther

Delphox, Heatran,
Genesect, Articuno

Reshiram, Lugia,
Talonflame
srankingStrategy:
M-Gengar will do wonders here again.
Make sure your first match removes
as many rocks as possible, then
the combos will follow.
notes:
Moves: At least 3 moves left

After some tries itemless you should get it,
it's just about luck from the combos.

pokemon:
Board: 2 Tyrunt and Rocks. The pattern of
columns 1,2,5 and 6 repeats in the skyfall
on 18 more rows
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Barrier Metal blocks every
          4 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Lucario]/[Mawile]/
[Medicham]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]

Milotic, Steelix, Klinklang,
Conkeldurr, Pangoro

Gallade, Cobalion,
Virizion, Gliscor

Shaymin, Palkia,
Machamp
srankingStrategy:
Easy stage. Just match in the middle
and you will beat it, because it does
not have a lot of HP.
notes:
Moves: At least 8 moves left

Moves +5 will get you this.

pokemon:
Board: 4 Metal blocks and 6 Sealeo
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Sealeo and 3 Metal blocks
          on row 1 every 3 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Blaziken]/[Charizad Y]/
[Mawile]/[Gengar]

Steelix, Klinklang,
Conkeldurr, Sealeo,
Tyranitar

Gallade, Delphox,
Moltres, Terrakion

Talonflame, Dialga,
Ho-Oh
srankingStrategy:
Gengar coupled with Gallade, Dialga
and Tyranitar can beat this stage
itemless. Focus on removing the
metal blocks first, then either match
the Sealeo together or eject them
slowly with Sealeo or Tyranitar.

Doable itemless, Mawile and Lucario
work fine as Mega too, and should you
struggle, Moves +5 should be enough
to beat this stage.
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

It is nice to try to catch Sealeo and bring it
in place of Tyranitar. Managed to S rank
itemless with Gengar, Gallade, Dialga and
Sealeo. It's very combo reliant, so
Moves +5 serves as a nice safety.

If you bring Sealeo there is no point in buying
a Disruption Delay. Get a DD only if you're
not bringing Sealeo to S rank this, and if
Moves +5 will not be enough judged from
your itemless tries.

pokemon:
Board: 4 Rocks and 8 Barrier Fearow
Initial: Adds 2 Fearow and 1 Rock
Timer: Moves >=10: Adds 2 Fearow and 
          1 Rock every 3 moves

          Moves <=10: Adds 6 Fearow and
          6 Metal blocks on rows 2 and 3
          every 3 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]

Avalugg, Dedenne,
Tyranitar

Zapdos, Articuno,
Mamoswine, Luxray

Thundurus, Kyurem,
Zekrom
srankingStrategy:
This stage is annoying. Doable without
items, but annoying. Try to match the
Fearow on the left as soon as possible
to free some space for combos.

Then use Tyranitar to eject the ones
coming from disruptions. With M-
Ampharos, you will clean up the rest.

Zekrom will come into play for the 
ending, taking care of the Metal blocks.
notes:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Bringing Fearow to S rank this stage is
helpful. If you manage to get lucky with
the abilities and even from board start,
you don't need a Moves +5 for the S rank.
It is however a nice help in case you
do not want to try many times.

pokemon:
Board: 2 Metal blocks and 10 Rocks in 
          columns 2 and 5
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Mankey, 5 Rocks and
          1 Metal blocks (initial board pattern)
          every 3 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Mewtwo Y]/[Slowbro]/
[Gardevoir]

Braviary, Salamence,
Deoxys, Togekiss

Xerneas

Lugia, Cresselia, Victini
srankingStrategy:
Lugia is really helpful to eject the
Mankey, so that you can focus on
evolving M Mewtwo Y to deal tons
of damage. The level is not hard to
beat itemless, you may need a few
tries but it's very doable itemless.
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Bringing Mankey can yield an itemless
S rank quite easily. If you can't manage
to catch it, bring a Moves +5 to secure it
with a Psychic Team and Lugia.

pokemon:
Board: Rocks and Metal blocks
Initial: None
Timer: Disrupts the board with the initial 
          setup every 4 moves (12 Rocks
          on rows 1 and 6; 6 Metal blocks on
          rows 2 and 5)
clearingStrategy:
[Lucario]/[Mawile]/
[Medicham]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]

Milotic, Steelix, Klinklang,
Conkeldurr, Pangoro

Gallade, Cobalion,
Virizion, Gliscor

Shaymin, Palkia,
Machamp
srankingStrategy:
Hard board, hard disruptions, this stage
is definitely hard. Dialga or Gallade
are again very helpful to remove the
metal blocks.

Overall I think this stage is hardly
beatable itemless, you might require
a Disruption Delay to beat it
comfortably.

Garchomp works OK as Mega, Lucario
too.
notes:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

I went Disruption Delay, Mega Start and
Moves +5 with M-Garchomp and the team
on the screenshot. Every one of these items
was useful. Going with less is very risky
I feel.
The item to drop would be Mega Start, and 
then replace Garchomp with M-Gengar,
that can definitely work.

pokemon:
Board: 11 Magikarp and 11 Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds either 4 Magikarp, or
          3 Magikarp + 3 Barriers every 4
          moves
clearingStrategy:
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]/
[Venusaur]

Roserade, Gogoat,
Dedenne

Zapdos, Raikou, Virizion,
Luxray, Chesnaught

Zekrom, Thundurus,
Shaymin
srankingStrategy:
Seems hard at first glance, but quite
easy when you remove the barriers
and match some Magikarp.

Lugia is nice for this level when
ejecting 3 of them, worked well
with Gengar as Mega.
notes:
Moves: At least 8 moves left

Did it itemless with Gengar, Zekrom,
Lugia and Shaymin. Did not even need
sleep charm, so this seems like a solid
strategy.

If you managed to catch Magikarp, this
should be really easy with bringing it.

pokemon:
Board: 4 Metal blocks and 4 Rocks
Initial: None
Timer: Every 2 moves, choose one of the
           following:
          - Fill row 3 with Barriers
          - Fill row 4 with Barriers
          - Disrupts rows 2 and 3 like initial
board
          - Disrupts columns 2 and 3 like 
initial board
          - Disrupts columns 4 and 5 like 
initial board
clearingStrategy:
[Blastoise]/[Swampert]/
[Garchomp]

Excadrill, Milotic,
Stunfisk, Seismitoad,
Tyranitar

Terrakion, Greninja,
Gliscor, Suicune

Palkia, Groudon,
Kyogre, Gigalith
srankingStrategy:
Palkia and Gigalith are a great help
to fight against the possiblee disruptions

Stage beatable itemless, with Gengar 
as Mega or Garchomp.
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Moves +5 is a nice safety net, even though
it's possible to combo your way into
an itemless S rank with some luck.

No real need of a Disruption Delay.

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 4 Barriers, 4 Rocks or 4 Metal 
blocks
Timer: Adds 4 Barriers, 4 Rocks or 4 Metal
          blocks every 2 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Charizard Y]/[Blaziken]/
[Heracross]

Avalugg, Salamence,
Braviary, Scyther

Delphox, Heatran,
Genesect, Articuno

Reshiram, Lugia,
Talonflame
srankingStrategy:
Easy stage, although it's hard to
prepare for whatever disruption
it will throw at you. I find Abomasnow
to deal with all of them since he evolves
super fast.

The HP is quite low anyways so
you will have no trouble with this
stage. If you do, set a team for
2 of the 3 possible disruptions, and
keep on playing until you get lucky
with them :)
notes:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Doable itemless if the disruption RNG
is with you.

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 4 Metal blocks (2x2 square)
Timer: Adds a 2x2 Metal block square
          every 3 moves
 
          HP<=54%:
          Adds 6 Metal blocks every 3 moves
(2x2 + 1x2)
clearingStrategy:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Venusaur]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]

Avalugg, Milotic, Gogoat,
Roserade

Virizion, Mamoswine,
Chesnaught

Shaymin, Kyurem,
Kyogre, Staross
srankingStrategy:
It is a pretty good idea to bring Dialga
heree, there are a lot of Metal blocks.

Abomasnow or Glalie are nice for 
clearing disruptions too, haven't tried
with Blastoire or Venusaur.

The stage is beatable itemless if you
bring a Block Smash+ Pokémon,
else you might require a Moves +5
to give you more time to beat it.
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Possible itemless with a Block Smash+
Pokémon if you manage to trigger it
consistently while keeping up combos (so
not that easy).

Moves +5 is a good safety net.

Full Candied Rayquaza is apparently very
strong, it can be a better version of 
M-Gengar

pokemon:
Board: Pre determined
Initial: None
Timer: None
clearingStrategy: Any
srankingStrategy: Solution: B5-B6; D5-B4
notes:
Moves: At least 0 moves left

Clearing strategy will do this.

pokemon:
Board: Barriers on the 3 bottom rows
Initial: None
Timer: Fill a row or column (n° 2,3,4 or 5)
           with Barriers every 3 moves

           HP<=52%:
           Adds 6 Barriers on rows 2-3 or rows
           4-5 every 3 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]/
[Venusaur]

Roserade, Gogoat,
Dedenne

Zapdos, Raikou, Virizion,
Luxray, Chesnaught

Zekrom, Thundurus,
Shaymin
srankingStrategy:
Stage is really not hard. Remove the
Barriers bits by bits while getting some
combos and you'll be fine.
notes:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Doable itemless.

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: Fills row 4 with Rocks, and adds 6
          Rocks
Timer: Fills row 4 with Rocks, and adds 6
          Barrier Rocks every 2 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Venusaur]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]

Avalugg, Milotic, Gogoat,
Roserade

Virizion, Mamoswine,
Chesnaught

Shaymin, Kyurem,
Kyogre, Staross
srankingStrategy:
Stage beatable itemless. Abomasnow
or Glalie do a nice job at clearing the
disruptions. Kyogre can remove some
additional rocks too.
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Can be done itemless. Moves +5 in case
you're short on moves when doing it
itemless.

pokemon:
Board: Some Magnemite, Magneton and
           Magnezone; 5 Rocks
Initial: None
Timer: HP<=52%:
           Adds a mix of Magnemite, Magneton
           Magnezone and Metal every 2
           moves (5 blocks every time)
clearingStrategy:
[Garchomp]/[Gengar]

Krookodile, Stunfisk,
Marowak, Excadrill

Gliscor

Groudon, Landorus
srankingStrategy:
First move: F1-A4. Will clear all
non support Pokémon.

With M-Garchomp or M-Gengar, the
stage is easy to clear. No worries here.

No particular pokémon needed either,
Camerupt and Power of 4 is nice,
but Marowak and Stunfisk are also
good here with hitting Streak.
notes:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Possible itemless, skyfall smiled to me
and I managed to get this S rank itemless.

Moves +5 is a good safety net, you should
not need a Disruption Delay for this one.

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 6 Teddiursa on rows 1 and 2
Timer: Adds 6 Teddiursa on rows 1 and 2
         every move
clearingStrategy:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Mewtwo X]/[Gengar]

Conkeldurr, Mienshao,
Sawk, Pangoro

Gallade

Machamp
srankingStrategy:
Stage is beatable itemless. Bring your
Gengar as Mega, it works
fine. Machamp can eject the
disrupted Teddiursa, but you can also
choose to match them.
notes:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Doable itemless If you caught Teddiursa,
consider bringing it with M-Gengar, S rank
will be easy that way.

Still can work itemless without Teddiursa,
it will still be easy to get combos rolling.
Of course, Moves +5 will secure this very
easily provided you always beat the stage
itemless.

disruptions:
soon, forgot to take it so
will do it when i have 
hearts to spend


sorry
pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 1 Barrier on row 1
Timer: Adds 1 Barrier on row 1 every move

           HP<=39%:
           Adds 6 Barriers every 2 moves

Additional support: Metal blocks
clearingStrategy:
[Garchomp]/[Gengar]/
[Aerodactyl]

Krookodile, Stunfisk,
Marowak, Excadrill

Gliscor

Groudon, Landorus
srankingStrategy:
Metal blocks are skyfalling on this
stage, so bringing M-Aerodactyl is
a good  move.
On top of that, a lot of barriers will be
spawned, and no Ground pokémon
deals well with that. If you have Gliscor,
now is its time to shine.

Disruption Delay is not a must have
to complete the stage, but is helpful
if your pokémon are not that strong.
notes:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Best strategy is M-Aero with Mega Start 
and Moves +5. Better not activate Gliscor's
ability in that setup to get the damage on
M-Aero.

It is not crazy to consider adding a 
Disruption Delay on top of MS and +5, 
just to be safe.

pokemon:
Board: 2 Barrier SImipour, 2 Metal blocks,
          6 Rocks (H shape)
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 4 Metal blocks every 2 moves
          (or 3 Metal blocks and 1 Simipour)
clearingStrategy:
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]/
[Venusaur]

Roserade, Gogoat,
Dedenne

Zapdos, Raikou, Virizion,
Luxray, Chesnaught

Zekrom, Thundurus,
Shaymin
srankingStrategy:
Annoying stage. Beatable itemless
but also dependant on how combos
favours you. Zekrom is super nice
to remove the metal blocks, you may
want to bring another Block Smash+
if you do not have Zekrom.

Tropius is nice to eject the Simipour
away
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

It's possible with only Moves +5, but not
gonna lie, Disruption Delay is super useful
here.

pokemon:
Board: Rocks on row 5, Barriers on row 6
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Kabuto and a Metal block
          (placed together) after every move
clearingStrategy:
[Lucario]/[Mawile]/
[Medicham]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]

Milotic, Steelix, Klinklang,
Conkeldurr, Pangoro

Gallade, Cobalion,
Virizion, Gliscor

Shaymin, Palkia,
Machamp
srankingStrategy:
Easy stage, you should have no trouble
beating it.

M-Gengar does wonders here again.
notes:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Doable itemless.

pokemon:
Board: 8 Smoochum and 8 Metal blocks
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 8 Rocks and 8 Smoochums
          in columns 2 to 5 every 4 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Blaziken]/[Charizad Y]/
[Mawile]

Steelix, Klinklang,
Conkeldurr, Pangoro,
Tyranitar

Gallade, Delphox,
Moltres, Terrakion

Dialga, Machamp,
Talonflame
srankingStrategy:
Easy stage to beat itemless.
First move: F2-B6 removes all
Smoochum (careful not to acitvate
Eject with Tyranitar)

Bring
Dialga or Talonflame to remove Rocks
fast, and then just arrange for the
Smoochums to match each other.
notes:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Moves +5 will do this easily. It is a bit
harder to get it without Moves +5, so unless
you are willing to try a lot of times, get a
Moves +5.

You can also bring Smoochum if you
caught it, for an itemless S rank.

pokemon:
Board: 4 Metal blocks and 6 Rocks (Y shape)
Initial: None
Timer: Adds either of the following every 2
          moves:
           - 2 Metal blocks and 2 Rocks
           - 4 Barriers
           - 2 Metal blocks and 4 Rocks

           HP<=40%:
           Adds 4 Metal and 4 Rocks; or 8
           Barriers every 3 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Charizard Y]/[Blaziken]/
[Heracross]

Avalugg, Salamence,
Braviary, Scyther

Delphox, Heatran,
Genesect, Articuno

Reshiram, Lugia,
Talonflame
srankingStrategy:
While Abomasnow can mega evolve 
quite quickly, I found that Gengar
works OK as mega if you don't have
the former. Talonflame is really helpful,
as there will be metal blocks. 
Can be barriers too, so bring also
Reshiram or Emboar (or Avalugg).

Stage doable itemless, or with
Moves +5 if you lack some of the
Pokémon with key abilities.
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Can be done with only Moves +5, but is
reliant on luck (combos and abilities 
activations).
I raged after missing by
1 move 3 times in a row, and went with
Moves +5 and Disruption Delay.
Gengar was my Mega, was having more
success than with Abomasnow.

pokemon:
Board: 11 Lumineon (5 Barrier) in fish shape;
          4 Metal blocks
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 5 Barriers and 3 Lumineon
          every 3 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]/
[Venusaur]

Roserade, Gogoat,
Dedenne

Zapdos, Raikou, Virizion,
Luxray, Chesnaught

Zekrom, Thundurus,
Shaymin
srankingStrategy:
You can place a Lumineon on F3 to
remove the barriers, and then again in
F3 or A2 or A5 or D5 to get rid of
a lot. But they will come again...
Zekrom is useful to get rid earlier of the
metal in the bottom right.

Then it's about combos again, you can
also try to activate Shaymin's Sleep
Charm to give you some time. And
then Virizion deals the damages.
notes:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Moves +5 is good enough here. Else,
you can bring Lumineon if you caught it,
and you can do this stage itemless
with that.

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: Adds a 2x2 Metal blocks square
Timer: Adds a 2x2 Metal blocks square
          every 3 moves

          HP<=42%:
          Adds 3 Metal blocks and 3 Rocks in
          rows 1 and 2 every 2 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]/
[Venusaur]

Roserade, Gogoat,
Dedenne

Zapdos, Raikou, Virizion,
Luxray, Chesnaught

Zekrom, Thundurus,
Shaymin
srankingStrategy:
Lord Helix was blessed with an easy
stage. M-Gengar acts as a Complexity
-1, so he is pretty effective here.
Zekrom takes care of the metal blocks,
but even without it the stage is easy
itemless.
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Doable itemless with the team showed in
the board setup.

It is not crazy to think about adding a
Moves +5 to secure the S rank, it is a bit
luck reliant. But not more is needed.

pokemon:
Board: 6 Weeble and 6 Rocks in the middle
          columns
Initial: None
Timer: Disrupts the initial pattern in column
          3 and 4 every 4 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Mewtwo Y]/[Slowbro]/
[Garchomp]

Excadrill, Stunfisk,
Deoxys, Marowak

Glisccor

Cresselia, Victini,
Groudon
srankingStrategy:
Easy stage itemless. Match near the
Rocks to make 3 Weeble match, and
they will make the others match too.
Repeat after every disruption.
notes:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Doable itemless, Mega Mewtwo Y does a
nice job with 2 more Psychic types and
your best Super Effective.

Moves +5 if you find yourself always
short.

pokemon:
Board: 6 Sentrets and 6 Rocks in the
          bottom 2 rows
Initial: None
Timer: Add 3 Sentrets after every move

Note: Metal blocks can be spawned, even 
         though there is nothing written about
         that anywhere. Bring Gallade just in
         case
clearingStrategy:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Mewtwo X]

Conkeldurr, Mienshao,
Sawk, Pangoro

Gallade

Machamp
srankingStrategy:
Easy stage to beat. The disruptions
can make some of the Sentret
disappear, or you have Machamp
for that too.

Bring Gallade in case Sentret disrupts
Metal blocks, which can happen
despite the patch notes saying
differently.
notes:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Doable itemless if the disruptions are
favourable. Else, Moves +5 is more than
enough to secure it.

pokemon:
Board: None 
Initial: Adds 2 Furret or 3 Metal blocks
Timer: Adds 2 Furret or 3 Metal blocks every
          2 moves

          HP<=39%:
          Adds 5 Metal blocks every 2 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Mewtwo X]

Conkeldurr, Mienshao,
Sawk, Pangoro

Gallade

Machamp
srankingStrategy:
This stage is harder. Disruptions can
be quickly overwhelming. Gallade and
Machamp can take care of them,
but they appear at a fast rate.

Gengar or Rayquaza work nice as
Mega here, it's possible to finish
the stage itemless with some 
combo luck.
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

I don't think getting a Disruption Delay
is too much of an overkill here. It is
possible to S rank with only Moves +5,
but it takes a lot of luck to do so.

I tried my newly acquired Mega Mewtwo X,
I must say it does OK. But I couldn't make it
better enough to get rid of an item.

pokemon:
Board: 2 Metal blocks in every corner, and
           4 Barrier Metal blocks in the center
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 4, 5 or 6 Metal blocks and
          Barriers (row 1 or 6, or 4 in the
          center) every 3 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Venusaur]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]

Avalugg, Milotic, Gogoat,
Roserade

Virizion, Mamoswine,
Chesnaught

Shaymin, Kyurem,
Kyogre, Staross
srankingStrategy:
Did someone say hard stage? Well,
there you are. Disruption Delay is
pretty much non negociable here,
the disruptions are atrocious, and there
is no Block Smash+ super effective
pokémon ._.
There is Keldeo but at this rate I feel
it is useless. Maybe bringing a
Block Smash+ isnt that bad, also
Abomasnow or Glalie evolve quite
fast and could take care of all
those blocks. Abomasnow would
deal better with Barriers on row 1.
notes:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

GGRRRRRRRRR
Moves +5, Disruption Delay, and Mega
Start with M-Rayquaza + Optimise (I have
0 candies on my Rayquaza) did the trick
with exactly 10 moves left.

pokemon:
Board: 6 Rocks and 6 Kakuna (pattern is
          repeated 4 times in the skyfall)
Initial: Adds 6 Barriers in rows 3 and 4 (on
          top of the rocks)
Timer: Adds 6 Barriers in rows 3 and 4
           every 4 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Mewtwo Y]/[Slowbro]/
[Garchomp]

Excadrill, Stunfisk,
Deoxys, Marowak

Glisccor

Cresselia, Victini,
Groudon
srankingStrategy:
It's possible to remove quite a lot of
Kakuuna by matching near the Rocks,
since there are predetermined Kakuna
in the skyfall too. Overall not a bad
stage to beat itemless, I have had
same success with Mewtwo Y or
Garchomp. Gengar works fine as
Mega too. Just make the Kakuna
match without matching them directly,
and that will be  enough damage to
beat this stage itemless.
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Doable with only Moves +5, but to be
honest I also used a Disruption Delay
after failing 3 times by 2 moves. It's not
that easy when you don't have nice setups
to remove the Kakuna.

pokemon:
Board: 8 Metal blocks and 4 Rocks in the
          center, square shape
Initial: None
Timer: Disrupts the initial pattern of Rocks
         and Metal blocks every moves
clearingStrategy:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Mewtwo X]

Conkeldurr, Mienshao,
Sawk, Pangoro

Gallade

Machamp
srankingStrategy:
M-Medicham is nice and removes a
lot of the disruptions. Stage beatable
itemless, especially if you manage to
trigger Block Smash+ with Gallade
early on to mega evolve Medicham.
notes:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Moves+5 and Disruption Delay are nice,
but if you use DD then you can use Gengar
as Mega instead of Medicham, will bring
more combo power.

pokemon:
Board: None 
Initial: Adds 8 Rocks and 1 Metal block 
         (3x3 square with the metal in the
          middle of it)
Timer: Adds 8 Rocks and 1 Metal block
          every 2 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Mewtwo Y]/[Slowbro]/
[Garchomp]

Excadrill, Stunfisk,
Deoxys, Marowak

Glisccor

Cresselia, Victini,
Groudon
srankingStrategy:
Disruptions are pretty bad here.
Disruption Delay is highly recommended

Other than that, Mewtwo X + 2 Psychic
and your best Super effective will takt it
easily with Disruption Delay. Not much
more to add.
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

You can get the S rank using the Disruption
Delay only, but Moves +5 is a very nice
safety net (one day I will stop repeating
that I promise)

pokemon:
Board: Metal blocks on row 6 and 4 Rocks
Initial: Adds 4 Primeape in cross shape
         with a Barrier in the center
Timer: Adds 4 Primeape in cross shape
         with a Barrier in the center every 2
         moves
clearingStrategy:
[Mewtwo Y]/[Slowbro]/
[Gardevoir]/[Gengar]

Braviary, Salamence,
Deoxys, Togekiss

Xerneas

Lugia, Cresselia, Victini
srankingStrategy:
This stage is easy to beat when you
manage to take care of the barriers
and when the Primape can match
each other after the disruptions.

Very doable itemless.
notes:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Gengar, Lugia and Cresselia are all you 
need against what Primeape throws at you.

If you caught Primeape, you can also bring
it instead of Lugia and it's super easy.

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 3 Metal blocks in a column
Timer: Adds 3 Metal blocks in a column
           every 2 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Blaziken]/[Charizad Y]/
[Mawile]

Steelix, Klinklang,
Conkeldurr, Pangoro,
Tyranitar

Gallade, Delphox,
Moltres, Terrakion

Dialga, Machamp,
Gigalith
srankingStrategy:
Bring on the Block Smash+ crew to
beat this stage without much trouble.

Here again, M-Gengar works fine if
you manage to remove the metal blocks
right after they are spawned.

No items needed.
notes:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Possible with Moves +5 only if you bring
the Block Smash+ crew. Will require some
good combos though while matching the
Block Smash+ to instantly remove the
disruptions.

Safer call is Moves +5 and Disruption
Delay, and you can bring your best Super
Effective instead of only Block Smash +
(especially to replace Talonflame which is
only BP 60)

pokemon:
Board: Barrier Metal blocks, Rocks and
          4 Krokorok
Initial: None
Timer: None
clearingStrategy:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Venusaur]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]

Avalugg, Milotic, Gogoat,
Roserade

Virizion, Mamoswine,
Chesnaught

Shaymin, Kyurem,
Kyogre, Staross
srankingStrategy:
Just do so that you get the Krokorok
match in second column, and you
will beat this stage.

C5-D5 and then F5-C3 should work to
accomplish that.
notes:
Moves: At least 0 moves left

Clear the stage and that's it. Free S rank
in the bag.

pokemon:
Board: None 
Initial: Adds a 3x3 square of 5 Metal blocks
          and 4 Rocks
Timer: Adds a 3x3 square of 5 Metal blocks
          and 4 Rocks every 2 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Mewtwo Y]/[Slowbro]/
[Garchomp]

Excadrill, Stunfisk,
Deoxys, Marowak

Glisccor

Cresselia, Victini,
Groudon
srankingStrategy:
Buy a Disruption Delay. Really. The
disruptions are awful.
Wih that said, a Psychic team with
M-Mewtwo Y will take care of this
stage.
notes:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Disruption Delay can be enough on its own,
but Moves +5 is a huge help here, will
be an almost guaranteed S rank with.

pokemon:
Board: Rocks on the 2 top rows
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 4 Rocks after 1 move x3
          Then fills column 3 or 4 with 
          Barriers x1
          Repeat
clearingStrategy:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Charizard Y]/[Blaziken]/
[Heracross]

Avalugg, Salamence,
Braviary, Scyther

Delphox, Heatran,
Genesect, Articuno

Reshiram, Lugia,
Talonflame
srankingStrategy:
Your classic Gengar team for a 3
pokémon level. No need for items,
stage is easy to beat.
notes:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Doable itemless.

pokemon:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 6 Metal blocks
Timer: Adds 6 Metal blocks every 2 moves
clearingStrategy:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Venusaur]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]

Avalugg, Milotic, Gogoat,
Roserade

Virizion, Mamoswine,
Chesnaught

Shaymin, Kyurem,
Kyogre, Staross
srankingStrategy:
No super effective Block Smash+
pokémon again, thanks a lot.
Stage is doable itemless, you can
still bring a Block Smash+ poké
so that you don"t get overwhelmed.

Disruption Delay is still nice to consider
for this stage. Don't bring Abomasnow
or Glalie if you buy a DD though, bring
Gengar instead.
notes:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Disruption Delay and Moves +5 are really
nice here. Can use Gengar as Mega with
these, works as a Complexity-1 and
no metal to deal with so Gengar is optimal.

pokemon:
Board: Metal block in every corner, and
          4 Barriers in the center
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 5 Metal blocks every 2 moves

Added support: Mewtwo. Will be replaced by
                     Happiny if you take Mewtwo
                      with you.
clearingStrategy:
[Mewtwo Y]

Braviary, Salamence,
Deoxys, Togekiss

Xerneas

Lugia, Cresselia, Victini
srankingStrategy:
I am not sure what is the minimum
needed for this stage as I jumped to
full item run immediately to get the S
rank, since I want them all anyways.

Mewtwo is the added support, and is
super effective. But if you take it as
your mega, then Happiny happens...
I haven't tried with Mega Slowbro really,
but Mewtwo Y is a really good mega
and acts a bit like a Complexity -1,
so it should be OK.

Disruption Delay and Moves +5 is
probably enough to get it, considering
I took around 70% HP itemless on my
itemless try.

 There is sadly
no one super effective with Block
Smash+, hence the usefulness of
Disruption Delay.
notes:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Go full item run, you need all these items
to S rank this level.
mobileNotes:
Congratulations! You get a Mega-
Mewtwoite X
